dt: {bc}to reduce the mental or moral vigor of
{bc}to lessen the vitality or strength of

pt: {sc}unnerve{/sc} {sc}enervate{/sc} {sc}unman{/sc} {sc}emasculate{/sc} mean to deprive of strength or vigor and the capacity for effective action. {sc}unnerve{/sc} implies marked often temporary loss of courage, self-control, or power to act.
{sc}enervate{/sc} suggests a gradual physical or moral weakening (as through luxury or indolence) until one is too feeble to make an effort.

pt.t: a nation's youth {it}enervated{/it} by affluence and leisure

pt: {sc}unman{/sc} implies a loss of manly vigor, fortitude, or spirit.

pt.t: a soldier {it}unmanned{/it} by the terrors of battle

pt: {sc}emasculate{/sc} stresses a depriving of characteristic force by removing something essential.

et: Latin {it}enervatus{/it}, past participle of {it}enervare{/it}, from {it}e-{/it} + {it}nervus{/it} sinew {ma}{mat|nerve|}{/ma}
shortdef: to reduce the mental or moral vigor of
to lessen the vitality or strength of
